definition: to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)

sentences.english: They took the bones one by one out of the grave, and wrapped each individually.
sentences.chinese: 他們一塊一塊地把遺骨取出墓穴，每塊都單獨包起來。

sentences.english: It identified the remains of most of these are Mongolian.
sentences.chinese: 據鑑定，這些遺骨多數屬於蒙古人種。

sentences.english: Soon, the Everts found their father.
sentences.chinese: 很快，埃弗特一家找到了他們父親的遺骨。

definition: to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
Huanghuagang (Chrysanthemum Hill) in Guangzhou, scene of disastrous uprising of 23rd April 1911
to die of old age/to die in one's bed at a ripe old age
to put dead body in coffin
fire of war everywhere (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
